formattedAddress: 153 E 67th St, New York, NY 10065, USA
adrFormatAddress: 153 E 67th St, New York, NY 10065, USA

originalText.text: I was trying to make a police report today and a coop standing in front of the building asked what I needed. I briefly talked about the situation and don't want to waste my time with him while it was raining and there is leaking under the hall. He said I can't make a report and then asked me to leave. I tell him more details and he said I was changing the story and can't make a report. I asked to speak with someone in the front desk and he threat to use force against me if I don’t leave. I live in the neighborhood for many years and walked in the police office several times. No one deny my entry like that, it was so rude and disrespectful.

originalText.text: I respect the NYPD, but this precinct is a disaster. They don’t even show up if you report a crime. The upper east side has been dangerous lately, and its important for the neighborhood to feel safe

text.text: I respect the NYPD, but this precinct is a disaster. They don’t even show up if you report a crime. The upper east side has been dangerous lately, and its important for the neighborhood to feel safe

originalText.text: This past Sunday, coming out of Targets at 150  E. 86th Street, There was a man spitting on girls and then physically trying to push them in street or to the ground.   By the time police arrive, the man had ran into the subway.  I was thinking the police would have review the store cameras to get an ID but instead they made excuses to the young lady who was so terrified.  I am sure this person has and will strike again.  Until he does it to a little Caucasian girl, or pushes Simone in the tracks to get media coverage, it will mean nothing. Sad state of NYPD affairs.  The streets of NY were given back to crazies, psychos and patrolled “Uvalde” heart police that will do nothing when time to act but have lots of excuses when someone else does their job for them.  My advise to you gents,  find this guy before it is too late.  His actions have all the writings of someone escalating, soon to explode.  My apologies to that little girl.  I wish I was closer and more alert to the situation, but like NYs Bravest, I too failed to act.

originalText.text:
If you’re rich like my father these officers will help you cover up crimes against children they’ll go after the victim and tell them to shut up.
You can actually hear about how these detectives at the 19th precinct especially Officer Kung and this guy I just spoke to who keeps hanging up on me that they’re helping my rich father cover up crimes against children under color of authority it’s coercion it’s illegal it’s against regulations you can hear all about it on my YouTube channel Senator Sheldon Cooper and hear about how these guys deserve to lose their jobs and go to prison for helping my father who is just like Michael Valva or Jeffrey Epstein these detectives are disgusting reprehensible people now I have to call the state attorney general public integrity bureau because these guys don’t give a crap about child abuse theyre actually going to help my father abuse me to death

My father did the same exact thing to me the Michael Valva did to his kid that NYPD detective murdered his 11-year-old son

My father is mad he got kicked out of the Friars club in New York City for crimes against children and he thinks that’s my fault because he abused me that people found out about that so is blackmailing me that he’s going to put me into Rikers island of people find out that he abused as children and these cops are going to help him do it now I have to call internal affairs in the survey in complaint review board these people are disgusting

Senator Jason Scherl on YouTube for the topics that affect you by the way

originalText.text:
in my experience this precinct is wonderful and most professional. they consistently helped me deal with a domestic situation until i was able to get an order of protection. i have recognized officers in the neighborhood. new york city is really a small town when you consider individual neighborhoods.

i just looked and i see that there are some bad reviews.

might i suggest:
if you need their help - grab a book to read and go sit in the lobby and wait until someone is available who can help you. you can file your reports there. i spent time waiting for assistance and did not mind at all. in my mind - their time is more important than mine... they are shuffling  priorities.

who am i to demand priority?
-  this is a police team after all. sometimes shifts changed. my friends and i once waited an hour so we could get a  team to escort me to my apartment. i was in a situation where i could not go to my own apartment without police officers because a “friend” had claimed tenant rights and refused to leave. i was gone. but the police helped me each time i needed to visit home or confront him, including serving papers...

once my case was documented- they considerately helped in all i asked.
